name: Irish Farmers' Association
goal:
Defend the interests of Irish farmers by

Providing representation to Irish farmers through
lobbying of all European Institutions

Inform its members about important political, or legislative changes that may impact on them

The Brussels office provides the primary interface with the European Institutions and its job is to gather
intelligence on EU affairs, engage in and support lobbying efforts with the European Institutions and
build networks with other stakeholder organisations in Brussels
interests: Agriculture, Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, General and Institutional Affairs, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Regional Policy, Single market, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives: All issues directly or indirectly related to Agriculture and Trade which may have an impact on Irish Farmers
